intro: Cremanthodium obovatum, commonly known as the broad-leafed sandwort, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of southern Europe and western Asia. It is a member of the Caryophyllaceae family, characterized by its fleshy leaves and showy flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils, often in alpine or subalpine habitats. Its flowers are usually pink or white, with five petals that are broader at the base, giving it its common name. Cremanthodium obovatum is adapted to harsh environmental conditions and is often found in high-altitude environments.
